word: ABOUT A YEAR LATER A MR. BELL, WHO OWNED THE THIRTY ACRES LYING JUST EAST OF THE LOMA LINDA TRACT AND SOUTH OF THE RAILWAY, OFFERED IT TO US AT WHAT WE THOUGHT WAS A VERY LOW PRICE. THE BRETHREN CONSIDERED THE MATTER AND FELT FAVORABLE TO ITS PURCHASE. AS SISTER WHITE ALSO FAVORED IT, THE LAND WAS PURCHASED AT LESS THAN $100 AN ACRE. SINCE THAT TIME WE HAVE SEVERAL TIMES BEEN OFFERED $300 AN ACRE FOR A PORTION OF IT.
